aliases_ja: 脱退一時金裁定請求書

legal_basis.law: 国民年金法 / 厚生年金保険法
legal_basis.law_en: National Pension Act / Employees' Pension Insurance Act
legal_basis.deadline_description_en: Must claim within 2 years of losing your address in Japan (submitting move-out notification). Miss this deadline and you lose the right to claim permanently.
legal_basis.penalty_en: No penalty, but failure to claim within 2 years = forfeiture of all pension contributions.
legal_basis.cost_note_en: Free to apply. 20.42% income tax withheld from payment (refundable via tax representative).

overview.difficulty_en: MEDIUM — The form itself is straightforward, but the overall process has multiple steps spread across months: (1) move-out notification, (2) mail the claim form after departure, (3) wait 3-6 months, (4) receive 80% payment, (5) have tax representative file for the remaining 20%. Many people lose money by making mistakes in steps 4-5. NOTE: June 2025 reform extends the maximum payout period from 60 to 96 months (phased in over 4 years).
overview.timing_en: Prepare BEFORE leaving Japan. Submit the move-out notification (転出届) to your ward office ~2 weeks before departure. Mail the claim form to JPS after your planned departure date. You cannot apply while you still have a Japanese address.
overview.strategy_en: Designate your tax representative BEFORE leaving Japan. Prepare all documents in advance. Mail the application on or just after your departure date. Use a friend or professional — do NOT skip the 20% tax refund step.

requirements_en: You are NOT a Japanese citizen
You no longer have an address in Japan (submitted move-out notification)
You paid National Pension or Employee Pension premiums for 6+ months
You have NOT qualified for the Old-age Pension (requires 10+ years / 120+ months of contributions)
You have NEVER received a pension payment (including disability allowance)
Less than 2 years have passed since you lost your Japanese address
eligibility.important_warning_en: If you have 10+ years of pension contributions, you are eligible for the Japanese Old-age Pension at age 60+, which may be worth significantly more than the lump-sum withdrawal. Calculate both amounts before deciding. The lump-sum caps at 60 months of contributions — anything beyond that is lost.
eligibility.totalization_warning_en: Japan has pension totalization agreements with 20+ countries (including USA, UK, Germany, Australia, France, Canada). If you claim the lump-sum withdrawal, those enrollment periods CANNOT be used for totalization. Check if totalization is better for you before claiming.

national_pension.reading: こくみん ねんきん
national_pension.who: Self-employed, freelancers, unemployed residents, and student visa holders
national_pension.lump_sum_note: Fixed amounts based on months contributed. See payment table on JPS website.

employee_pension.reading: こうせい ねんきん
employee_pension.who: Company employees — premiums deducted from salary (split 50/50 with employer)
employee_pension.lump_sum_note: Amount based on average monthly salary × payment rate × months contributed. Generally larger than National Pension refund.

process_timeline.title_en: Prepare documents and designate tax representative
process_timeline.title_ja: 書類準備・納税管理人の届出
process_timeline.details_en: Gather your pension handbook, passport copies, bank details. File the Tax Representative Declaration (納税管理人の届出書) at your local tax office. Get your residence certificate (住民票) with Resident Register Code.

process_timeline.title_en: Submit move-out notification at ward office
process_timeline.details_en: Go to your ward/city office and submit 転出届 (tenshutsu todoke). This officially removes your Japanese address. Ask for a copy of your 住民票 with 住民票コード before they process the move-out.

process_timeline.title_en: Mail the claim form to Japan Pension Service
process_timeline.title_ja: 脱退一時金請求書の郵送
process_timeline.details_en: Mail the completed form with all supporting documents to JPS. The form MUST arrive after your planned departure date. You can mail it from overseas or drop it in a Japanese mailbox on your way to the airport.

JPS reviews your application (3-6 months). If approved, 80% of the lump-sum is deposited into your overseas bank account. 20.42% is withheld as income tax. You also receive a Payment Determination Notice (脱退一時金支給決定通知書) by mail.

process_timeline.title_ja: 納税管理人が確定申告
process_timeline.details_en: Send the original Payment Determination Notice to your tax representative in Japan. They file a tax return (確定申告書) at your former local tax office. The remaining ~20% is refunded to the tax representative's Japanese bank account, who then transfers it to you.

fields.note_en: 10-digit number from your Pension Handbook or Basic Pension Number Notice
Symbol number from Pension Handbook, if applicable. Can be left blank for most applicants.

sections.note_en: Write EVERYTHING in CAPITAL ROMAN LETTERS

fields.note_en: Full name as it appears on your passport. Write in CAPITAL LETTERS.
Your address OUTSIDE Japan where JPS can reach you by mail. Critical — if they can't reach you, your claim stalls.
International phone number including country code

sections.note_en: For overseas accounts, payment is in foreign currency. For Japanese accounts, payment is in yen. The account MUST be in YOUR name.

fields.note_en: Account holder name — must match the claimant name exactly
Required for overseas banks. 8 or 11 characters.
Required for European banks. US/Australia/Japan don't use IBAN.

sections.note_en: You must circle '請求する' (I claim the payment). This acknowledges that claiming forfeits your pension enrollment period — it cannot be used for future pension benefits or totalization agreements.

fields.note_en: Sign your name as it appears on your passport

documents_required.en: Lump-sum Withdrawal Payment Claim Form (download from JPS website)
Passport copy — page showing name, DOB, nationality, signature, residence status, AND departure stamp

documents_required.en: Copy of Pension Handbook or Basic Pension Number Notice

Copy of move-out notification (optional but recommended — proves you left Japan)

after_submission.ja: 日本年金機構で審査（3〜6ヶ月）
after_submission.en: JPS reviews your application — typically 3-6 months. They may send questions by mail to your overseas address.

after_submission.ja: 80%の脱退一時金が海外口座に振込
after_submission.en: 80% of the lump-sum is deposited to your bank account (20.42% withheld as tax).

after_submission.ja: 脱退一時金支給決定通知書が届く
after_submission.en: Payment Determination Notice (脱退一時金支給決定通知書) arrives by mail. KEEP THE ORIGINAL — you need it for the tax refund.

after_submission.ja: 原本を日本の納税管理人に送付
after_submission.en: Send the original notice to your tax representative in Japan.

after_submission.ja: 納税管理人が確定申告を提出
after_submission.en: Tax representative files a tax return (確定申告) at your former local tax office.

after_submission.ja: 残りの約20%が納税管理人の口座に還付
after_submission.en: The ~20% tax refund is deposited into tax representative's Japanese bank account (1-4 months after filing).

after_submission.ja: 納税管理人があなたの海外口座に送金
after_submission.en: Tax representative transfers the refund to your overseas account.

common_mistakes.fix_en: You CANNOT apply while you still have an address in Japan. Submit the move-out notification first, then mail the form on or after your departure date.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Waiting more than 2 years to apply
common_mistakes.fix_en: The 2-year deadline is absolute. Set a calendar reminder. You lose everything if you miss it.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Not designating a tax representative before leaving
common_mistakes.fix_en: Without a tax representative, you forfeit the 20% tax refund (~20% of your entire pension refund). File the 納税管理人の届出書 at your local tax office BEFORE departure.
JPS communicates ONLY by postal mail. If they can't reach you (wrong address, you moved), your claim stalls indefinitely. Use a stable address or a mail forwarding service.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Bank account name doesn't match passport name
common_mistakes.fix_en: The name on your bank account must EXACTLY match your name on the claim form and passport. Middle name mismatches are the #1 cause of payment delays.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Not getting the bank stamp on the form
common_mistakes.fix_en: The form has a section for your bank's official stamp (銀行証明印). If you can't get the stamp, attach a copy of your bankbook or recent statement instead.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Claiming when totalization would be better
common_mistakes.fix_en: Japan has pension totalization agreements with 20+ countries. If you've contributed to pensions in both Japan and your home country, totalization might give you a MUCH larger benefit at retirement than the lump-sum. Check before you claim — this decision is irreversible.
This original document (脱退一時金支給決定通知書) is required for the 20% tax refund. Make a copy before sending the original to your tax representative.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Forgetting the departure stamp in passport copy
common_mistakes.fix_en: JPS wants to see your departure stamp. Make sure you go through manned immigration (not automated gates) on your last departure, or request a stamp.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Not getting 住民票 with 住民票コード before submitting move-out
common_mistakes.fix_en: Request your residence certificate WITH Resident Register Code at the ward office BEFORE they process your move-out. You can't get it after. This speeds up JPS processing.

totalization_countries.explanation_en: Japan has social security agreements (pension totalization) with these countries. Pension periods in Japan can be combined with periods in these countries to qualify for benefits. If you claim the lump-sum withdrawal, you LOSE these periods permanently.
totalization_countries.note_en: Agreements vary by country. Some only cover specific pension types. Check the JPS website or contact your home country's social security agency for details.

payment_amounts.national_pension_note: Fixed amounts based on months contributed. As of FY2024: 6-11 months = ¥50,940; 12-17 months = ¥101,880; up to 60 months maximum.
payment_amounts.employee_pension_note: Calculated as: Average Standard Remuneration × Payment Rate (18.3% × 0.5 × months). Example: ¥300,000 average salary × 3 years = approximately ¥990,000 before tax.
payment_amounts.maximum_months_note: The lump-sum caps at 96 months (8 years) of contributions as of the June 2025 reform. Any contributions beyond 96 months are NOT refunded. This is the biggest reason to consider totalization if you've worked in Japan for many years.
payment_amounts.reform_note_en: June 2025 pension reform: The maximum payout period was extended from 60 months (5 years) to 96 months (8 years). This change is being phased in over 4 years. Check the JPS website for the current applicable cap based on when you file.
